A Blistering Exchange.desc: Two warriors, locked in combat since long ago, take a break from their intense fighting to block your way forward.

A Dark God Emerges.desc: As you exit Edila you're able to see the entrance to Amdahl Castle, but suddenly, a figure consumed by darkness blocks your way forward.

A Familiar Opponent.desc: Despite the rumors they were the strongest around, those two never crossed swords. Perhaps they understood what it really meant to be strong.

A Feast for Humanoids.desc: If you look closely it is obvious this road wasn't made this way by nature alone. It seems a great battle took place in this area.

A Flash of Lightning.desc: A summoned thunder king is blocking the path at the end of the wasteland. You must defeat him before continuing.

A Formidable Presence.desc: You feel a wicked pulse coming from deep within the Spirit World, but before you can reach it you must defeat a once legendary hero.

A Glorious Bloody End.desc: A pungent rusty metal odor pours into your nose. It's the smell of blood! The exit ought to be near, but there's no doubt something dreadful is waiting ahead.

A Guiding Star.desc: Locked in the throes of battle, a strange sensation overcomes you momentarily. You don’t know what caused it, but you decide to track its source...

A Hero's Destiny.desc: You're close enough to the tower that you have to look up to see where it ends. It's odd appearance causes a lump in your throught.

A Peaceful Courtyard.desc: Danger awaits you in the great courtyard at the center of Valtan Fortress. Defeat whatever it is to complete Lugina's mission.

A Putrid Abyss.desc: In a complete change of scenery, you come across a dark, rancid cave. Pass through this, and St. Lamia Palace awaits.

A Response to Devotion.desc: Grahdens's question planted a seed in its wake. However this is no time to get distracted. You must repay the goddess's favor.

A Roar from the Darkness.desc: The roar of an ancient dragon reverberates inside the walls of the tower. Only those able to conquer their fear are worthy of scaling the tower’s heights.

A Thirst for Blood.desc: Your senses suddenly heighten. Could it be this intense blood-thirsty presence you feel up ahead? It's already too late to turn back.

A Thunder God Strikes.desc: A sanctuary can be seen shining just beyond the mine. The exit seems to be within reach. All you have to do is defeat the enemies before you.

A Thunderous Attack.desc: The Heroes of Old longed for the life of a lone warrior, and if ever two of such warriors should meet their joy would rain down like lightning.

A Timeless Blaze.desc: There are now a lot of paths leading out. It looks like you'll be able to escape the mountains soon, however, you can feel something ahead, the presence of a strong enemy.

A Torch in the Darkness.desc: Who knows how long the simmering lava has been waiting in this cave for its chance to rise to the surface. Soon its pressure will force it out.

A Water God Appears.desc: It seems you must leave Amdahl if you are to defeat Cardes, but before that you need to escape the ghost ship.

A Wave of Blades.desc: You notice that the softly falling snow is starting to cover Karl's tracks. You must find him before you lose trace of him.

A White World.desc: All you see goes from steam to snow, and your once steaming hot body is instantly cooled. Worried about Karl, you continue after him.

A Year's Trajectory.desc:
A mysterious area that suddenly appeared in the Vortex.
On orders from the Akras Summoners' Hall, hunters are being sent to investigate the area and rid it of monsters.

A Young Girl's Wish.desc: Burnt houses, crumbling churches. There must've been many residents in a city as large as this. You can't help but hope that the victims have found peace.

Abandoned Ruins.desc: Past the damaged houses lies nothing but fiery ruins. Could these flames be the work of monsters?

Absolute Zero Lv. 3.desc: The ice cold air pricks at your skin, but what awaits ahead is a sibyl said to have a glacial glare even colder than ice.

Absolute Zero Lv. 4.desc: A blade of ice that shines clear and bright thanks to the blood of the people it has fed on. Perhaps this is a symbol of her true pure nature.

Accumulation of Lightning.desc: The placement of enemies is no accident. They were planted with great precision to wear you down, serving you up on a platter for Mare.

Affectionate Flames Lv. 3.desc: The Six Sibyl Sisters were said to have rescued many people. Here lays a shrine dedicated to one of them. Why was it they reached out to save the people?

Affectionate Flames Lv. 4.desc: The Blaze Sibyl saved the people with an affectionate heart of mercy. However, that in turn led to her fighting her sisters. The sadness from that fight still lingers.

All-Piercing Lightning.desc: A paralyzing presence inhabits the forest. You recognize this aura. It seems a warrior you've faced before awaits you once again.

An Encounter with Flames.desc: The scalding lava plunges at you all of a sudden. If it hits you, you'll suffer far more than fourth degree burns. However, worse dangers lie ahead...

An Invisible Presence.desc: The roar of the waterfall cascading around you drowns out the sound of approaching demons. They lurk in the water and shadows, waiting for their moment to pounce.

An Offer of Death.desc: Somehow, the cave exhibits signs of human civilization. Could there be manmade structures this far below the sea?

Asleep in the Ice.desc: There is a mountain range at the end of the Egor Plains where it is said an evil god who once destroyed several small nations slumbers.

Assault from Above.desc: You break through the frontal defenses only to find yourself ambushed yet again, but this time from above! Time to quiet this raging beast.

Balance of Power.desc: An exquisite view fills your eyes, of geological formations you have never seen. Use extra caution as you proceed.

Band of Thieves.desc: As Leon's influence and grew, he gathered a band of thieves who share the same ideals as his cause, help the weak crush the strong. Stealing from the rich to aid the poor.

Bandit of the Desert.desc: The bandits in this burning desert have much stronger resolve that those in Mistral, and it seems they intend to block your way.

Bandit of the Forest.desc: It's said that bandits occupy this forest. They may be tough, but there's no way to avoid them.

Basics of Battle.desc: It's time to discuss basic combat techniques!

Battle in a New Land.desc: A thick fog hangs around you as the light stench of rotten eggs fills the air. Be careful as it would all be over if you fell in the hole from which the steam pours.

Battling the Ice Dragon.desc: Frozen winds rush at you. The fact that the black cave of molten lava exists so close to this snowfield reminds you that nature is a force to be reckoned with.

Bearer of the God Arm Lv. 1.desc: Rebelling against his heritage as a blacksmith in his younger days, it'd take a lot more than strong wits to gain this man's allegiance.
Bearer of the God Arm Lv. 1.dungeon: Bearer of the Flaming God Arm

Bearer of the God Arm Lv. 2.desc: Creating his own path as a blacksmith, he has come to acknowledge the raw strength that others possess.
Bearer of the God Arm Lv. 2.dungeon: Bearer of the Flaming God Arm

Bearer of the God Arm Lv. 3.desc: He soon came to be known as the God Arm, though this power he only showed to those he deemed worthy.
Bearer of the God Arm Lv. 3.dungeon: Bearer of the Flaming God Arm

Bearer of the God Arm Lv. 4.desc: Smith Lord, people called him. For he forged an almighty weapon to fight against the gods' invasion.
Bearer of the God Arm Lv. 4.dungeon: Bearer of the Flaming God Arm

Beast Above the Wall.desc: As you try to escape the castle, you come to a giant wall of ice. Worse than that, two daunting warriors are lying in wait for you.

Before the Flame Princess.desc: A cold wind dries the sweat from your forehead. Could the exit be nearby? You spot a shaft of light, but it’s guarded by a formidable-looking foe...

Behind the Waterfall.desc: You pass behind the cascading waterfall and continue to the next area. Lugina’s warning plays in your mind, but you’re too curious to turn back now.

Beings from the Bush.desc: Monsters leap in attack from both the muddied water as well as the thick shrubs. You'd like to catch your breath, but it seems there's nowhere to rest.

Beneath Ebony Wings.desc: As if drawn by the heat of battle, monsters from far and wide descend upon your position. You can’t afford to rest until Lugina has defeated Grantos!

Beneath the Cascade.desc: A monster ambush interrupts your reverie with the scenery. Dispose of them and continue with your investigation.

Between Sea and Sky.desc: Arriving at the outskirts of the city you see a shockingly massive bridge. Before you can get to it you must confront the huge dragon on your tail.

Blade of the Heart.desc: You proceed around the outskirts of the bog as the rain drenches you. The enemy attacks are as relentless as the storm, taking their toll on your stamina.

Blade of the Victor.desc: One's belonging to the light is not set in stone. This is because one can never be fully clear that their principles are just. One must prove their righteousness with their blade.

Blades of Lightning.desc: Mare's strategy must be working exactly as planned. Almost completely worn out, you are practically a sitting duck for her.

Blazing Earth.desc: It's hot. Some cold water would be nice, but there's nothing here but boiling water. You're drenched in sweat, might as well wash off while you're here.

Boiling Muddy Water.desc: You've come to an odd smelling marshland. A strange fog hangs above the water's bubbling bottomless surface. There's no use sticking around here any longer.

Bolts and Bombs Lv. 1.desc: Being able to prophesy, the only way she could keep going despite the dreadful war was to smile and keep fighting.

Bolts and Bombs Lv. 2.desc: Though she lost her memory, she didn't lose her spark and will to fight, her grin only widening as she got stronger.

Bolts and Bombs Lv. 3.desc: A fortune-teller knows that there's no way to change fate. The only way to win is to laugh and make merry. Fight-oh!

Bound by Darkness.desc: The cave is even darker than the pitch black seafloor above it. Because of this, creatures of the dark have free reign.

Brave in the Face of Darkness.desc: Enemies continue attacking, allowing no room for rest. Could they be protecting the power that Paris said was hidden here?

Brave through the Ice.desc: Just as with Karl, you have faith that Grahdens is safe. But your loss of words to console Karl is regrettable.

Breath Freezing Snowfields.desc: You've emerged into a blizzard. It's so cold, watch out for enemies with water attacks.

Bright Flames, Bursting Light.desc: Despite how desolate these ruins are, there are no signs of weapons or human remains, and the air is fresh and clean.

Broken Days.desc: The smell of blood coming from near the gate opposite to the one you entered fills your nostrils. The tower is clos, but so is a very powerful enemy force.

Broken Silence.desc: You cross over the ash covered hills to find a beautiful lakeside. However, before you can rest another horde of new monsters appear before you.

Burny & Friends UNLEASHED! Lv. 1.desc: Frustrated that they're always being picked on, Burny and friends set out on a rampage to create chaos. MWAHAHAHA!

Bursts of Lightning.desc: Your ears begin ringing as lightning endlessly crashes down. The air is thick with the odor of a burnt tree which has been struck by lightning.

Castle Winds.desc: The Sky Fort is still far off. A faint magical power lingers in the pleasantly windblown air within the old castle. What could it be?

Cave of Dancing Flames.desc: The magma flowing within this cave gives off an intense heat. The enemies in this cave have the power of fire.

Cave-Dwelling Assassins.desc: Beyond the huge gate unfolds a fiery cave. It doesn’t look like you’ll find anything worthy of investigation here, so keep moving forward.

Celestial Garden.desc: This entrance to the heavens opens only once a day. Multiple kind of croaking can be heard from outside...

Challenge from the Underworld.desc: You've finally made it to the bridge's halfway point. As the enemies are growing stronger, it seems fighting through the second half will only be more difficult.

Cold-Hearted Sentries.desc: Two monstrous birds, more ferocious than anything else you’ve encountered, lie in wait to stop the advance of any would-be intruders into their territory.

Commander of the Thunder.desc: It looks to be a vast wetland. The terrain may prove more troublesome than the thunder-wielding enemies hiding in it.

Conqueror of the Heavens.desc: The exit is in sight, but a giant entity can be seen swooping down from the heavens, possibly to deliver your final trial...

Corridor of Ruin.desc: The tower's shaking has grown stronger. The oppressive rythmic sound bears heavily on your chest. What is it that Paris saw here?

Creator of the World.desc: At last, you've reached Maxwell. The battle to save Tilith and destroy the first of the four fallen gods begins now...

Crimson Fields.desc: Once a week, lunar shifts high above the world of Grand Gaia affects the emotional spectrum of bulbs. The fields glow red from the emergence of Fire Bulbs, wandering buzzed and excited.

Curse of the Ravine.desc: There is a rumor about a monster that lives in this ravine that turns everything it sees into stone. There are few who view this widely known ghost story as being true.

Cyclops of Lightning.desc: Mt. Wistorea is the steepest in the area, but its calm weather makes it the most comfortable environment so far.

Dance in the Clouds.desc: You finally reach the tower atop the cape. Head for its top for your showdown against Zevalhua. Defeat the Fallen God so you can save Grahdens!

Dance of Lightning Flames.desc: Is this only the halfway point? You can still hear the cries from the fierce battle raging below... It's time to hurry.

Dance of the Knight.desc: Countless monsters appear as if to drive the intruders from their hallowed tower. But what are they protecting? Part of Cordelica's past, or some other hidden truth?

Dark Metal Parade.desc: A grand procession featuring Dark Metal monsters with loads of Dark experience is coming your way! Don't miss out!

Dark Night Requiem.desc: The remains of a city thought to have at one time prided itself on its extravagance. It seems someone is controlling the spirits who would otherwise be at rest here.

Dark Surge.desc: There is light and darkness wherever you go. But still, where did the darkness in the Amdahl Empire come from? There's probably no longer anyone around that knows.

Daylight behind Her.desc: You avoided the god of destruction, but now you must face the warrior with eight blades on her back. This is a crucial stage--your enemies have no plans to rest.

Deadly Melody.desc: The higher you climb, the tougher the monsters seem to get. Amid all the chaos, the sound of a beautiful and bewitching singing voice beckons you ever higher.

Death and Rebirth.desc: Fire has both the power to incinerate everything and to restore life. Harnessing these powers, fallen gods continue to roam these lands as they always have.

Deception of the Spirit World.desc: An otherworldly warrior with some tricks up his sleeve blocks your exit from the old castle. He attacks with an indiscriminate barrage of gunfire!

Demon Blade of the Dark Lv. 1.desc: The half-demon daughter of a dark lord is always seeking thrill to feed her restless blood. Battle Maidens? Sounds like fun.

Demon Blade of the Dark Lv. 2.desc: Nothing bores her more than incompetent, weak fighters. The demon in her is telling her to fight to survive, devour to succeed.

Demon Blade of the Dark Lv. 3.desc: She doesn't care if a human, god or demon stands in her way. Her demon blade will only stop for someone who excites her… but only for brief while.

Demon Sword's Flash.desc: The closer you get to the tower, the more hightened your fear becomes. It's as if the tower itself was infused with some sort of evil energy.

Denial of Death's Curse.desc: Turning back, you see the ruins. Compared to that desolate yet pure place, the bridge is soaked in an ominous miasma. What could be waiting ahead?

Descending Force.desc: A warrior carrying a massive sword appears before you as you're searching for information on the Four Heroes. He swings at you as he approaches.

Dinner for Watchdogs.desc: You can hear the cry of not one beast but many coming from the fiery hills. Who could possibly command such fearful roars?

Discord of the Earth.desc: You continue deeper into the crimson forest. Suddenly, drops as red as blood fall down on you from the trees above.

Dragon Captain's Roadblock.desc: A wind blows in from outside. It's fresh feel invigorates you. However, you sense a powerful thirst coming from where the wind is blowing. It's likely a strong foe.

Dragon's Roar.desc: You can hear a water dragon's roar even from inside the ship. Is this howl meant to get rid of those who disturb the souls of the dead crew members?

Dragoon in the Shade.desc: Step after shaky step, you cross the surface of the frozen lake. Looking back, you realize you've made it exactly halfway. How long will the ice hold?

Dregs of Battle.desc: A spirit possessed by the thrill of battle, and the one who pursues it. As long as their fight continues, they will never disappear.

Drenched in Crimson.desc: A hero from another world is waiting for you on this floor. Though it will not be an easy fight, it should be a fair one since you made it this far.

Duel on the Bridge.desc: Not much longer to the tower. Lugina still hasn't shown up yet so it's highly likely he's waiting somewhere around here. Proceed with caution.

Duo of Virtue.desc: Defeated but finally freed, the couple wonders if their bond is still as strong as the past.

Dweller in the Darkness Lv. 1.desc: Living among the shadows, his pride as a ninja warrants him little contact with others. Few are harder to pin down than he.

Dweller in the Darkness Lv. 2.desc: Acting under the cover of night, there's no objective he can't achieve. Who knows what it'd take to capture such a man.

Dweller in the Darkness Lv. 3.desc: Enveloped in a burning red darkness, only the strongest could even stir this man, whose training has cleansed him of all desire.

Dweller in the Darkness Lv. 4.desc: A man whose soul that is one with the darkness and mastered total discipline within. To see a red glow in the shadows would deem one's certain death.

Dwelling of the Souls.desc: There is a nagging chill in the air, though it isn't necessarily cold. Could it be this malicious air that surrounds you?

Earth Metal Parade.desc: A grand procession featuring Earth Metal monsters with loads of Earth experience is coming your way! Don't miss out!

Earth Shattering Lightning Storm.desc: The cacophony of thunder threatens to burst your eardrums. Each time the lightning strikes, so do your enemies' swords, raising the hair on the back of your soaked neck.

Element & Skill.desc: Memorize the strengths and weaknesses of each elements and how to trigger the Brave Burst!

Endless Barrage.desc: The monsters' aggression grows stronger as if they're trying to buy time for Zebra to recover from the wounds he was dealt during his battle with Tilith.

Endless Wisdom and Vitality.desc: A stomach-turning stench fills the moist humid air. Even when the bad smell breaks, you're left with the choking fragrance of vegetation.

Enlightenment of the Ages.desc: It seems the demon Graham who escaped from Mistral has shown up around here. Could this strong presence coming from ahead be him? Or maybe...

Entering the Foliage.desc: On the other side of the huge waterfall a vast forest stretches as far as the eye can see. According to Lugina, the monsters here are the most dangerous you’ve faced.

Enthralled by the Moon Lv. 3.desc: The shrine sparkles like a star scattered sky. Just like the night sky it is breathtaking yet terrifying, awakening one's primal fear of the dark.

Enthralled by the Moon Lv. 4.desc: She was too engrossed in pursuing her ideals which is why she couldn't forgive anything. Regardless the passage of time, this never changed.

Escape the Sky Fort.desc: Escape the Sky Fort for the sake of the wounded Tilith and those who stand guard over her! Mow down any who stand in your way!

Evade the Oncoming Hordes.desc: Hordes of monsters are blocking your path. Defeat them all as you advance forth! You've nearly made your way to Zebra!

Evil Conviction.desc: The cave is wide open before you. You should be able to get to the tower through here. You'd better prepare yourself for surprise attacks.

Exceeding Defiance.desc: A sudden surge of blood curdling power seeping down from the floor above stops you in your tracks. Prepare yourself and head up to where your two foes await.

Extermination Barrier.desc: This could be the final floor. However, you feel the presence of the Four Heroes coming from behind the door leading to the roof. You must defeat them to advance.

Face of a Saint.desc: You've come to a plaza in the middle of the ruins. An enormous church embodies the former power of this devastated city.

Fairy Royalty.desc: One can feel the history of Castle Avenia in all its elegance. After its original lord perished, a new royal family settled in.

Faith in Comrades.desc: The Spirit World grows unstable as the seal nears its breaking point. Uncertain of where Cardes may be, you must believe in your comrades and move forth!

Fall of the Lightning Fortress.desc: It seems these ruins were once used as a fortress. There are armories lined with spears, though each one of them is covered with rust.

Fire Breath, Thunder Fangs.desc: Though not hot enough to burn the skin, the air here is hot. In addition, it is also very thin. Do your best to retain consciousness.

Fire Maiden's Table.desc: Lugina told your enemies to do their worst, but they are fiercer than you anticipated. Their spirit of kinship and heroism permeates the air.

Fire Metal Parade.desc: A grand procession featuring Fire Metal monsters with loads of Fire experience is coming your way! Don't miss out!

Flames in the Night.desc: No matter where you look there's nothing but dried up trees, ash, and rocks. This place has no hopes of ever seeing water. You must get out of hear quickly.

Flames of Justice Lv. 1.desc: There is nothing more worth fighting for than justice. She will not hesitate to launch her missiles at anything she deems unrighteous.

Flames of Justice Lv. 2.desc: When she is angered, only destruction awaits. Stand in her way and be prepared to get blown away.

Flames of Justice Lv. 3.desc: Sparks fly as her war rockets blow her enemies away. Her passion for justice burns stronger than ever.

Fletchings of Anticipation.desc: Running alongside a white wall, you chase after the dragon that injured Tilith. Following its trail should lead you to where Karl is.

Float Like a Butterfly.desc: Hold off the hordes of giants as you move forward. You can't waste time with Tilith's current condition.

Flourishing Afterglow.desc: You've arrived at the ruins of the La Veda Republic. As ravaged as it is, there are still traces in the rubble of the people who used to live here.

Flower in the Frost Lv. 1.desc: A pirate as brutal as she is beautiful. Many have tried, and failed, to thaw her impenetrable icy heart...

Flower in the Frost Lv. 2.desc: Her ferocity and coldness of character are notorious throughout the seas. Rumor has it that even the Sea King was unable to dent her frosty exterior.

Flower in the Frost Lv. 3.desc: Her attacks and insults freeze the hearts of both enemies and allies alike. Captain of a huge fleet of pirate ships, she has no time for any but the strongest of individuals.

Flower in the Frost Lv. 4.desc: Frost forms on the ground she treads, fierce gales and icy blizzards tear through her foes. Her frozen wrath challenging the gods.

Forbidden Sacred Grounds.desc: You come across a clearing bathed in a dazzling light, but as Tilith's curse is growing stronger there is no time to enjoy it.

Forest Sanctuary.desc: According to a mysterious old man, this sanctuary holds information on the Four Heroes of Old. Take a quick detour and check it out.

Forest of the Nymphs.desc: Proceeding along a lightly foggy path, you come across the rulers of the forest. The ruler of trees and the master of fairies now stand before you.

Frail Spirit of the Forests.desc: A sea of red surrounds you as you walk through this forest. The grass, the flowers, everythings red. What's the meaning of this?

Freezing Stillness.desc: Hurry up the ivory stone steps. Who knows what kind of traps Mare set up ahead. Aim for the top, and proceed calmly, but quickly.

Frenzied Ballet.desc: You're now at the entrance to the Spirit World, but your way is blocked by two dark soldiers. Overflowing with power, their eyes brim with madness.

Frigid Breath.desc: A brisk wind blows upon you as you continue investigating the castle grounds.  The cool breeze feels like an invitation to death...

From Forest's Shadow.desc: You've come to a prairie covered in trees and shrubs, but what is that lurking in the shadows, seemingly ready to strike...

Frozen Blades.desc: As you try to escape the ghost ship to investigate, a frigid swordsman appears before you, along with his sword techniques which can turn anything to ice.

Frozen Halls.desc: The castle grounds are silent, and Tilith is nowhere to be found. There's nothing but frozen hallways leading in each direction.

Frozen Lake's Trap.desc: The shore is in view, you can finally get off the ice. Hurry up and get to the shore where there's no chance of slipping.

Full Moon Gathering Lv. 2.desc: As the moon reaches its fullest in the night sky, a mysterious gathering had begun. All too drawn to the beauty in the sky.

Gaia's Voice Lv. 3.desc: The land that was once covered with beautiful blossoming flowers now exists as a dark, cold place, just like the memories of the young Rose Sibyl.

Gaia's Voice Lv. 4.desc: The young Rose Sibyl was best known for her sweet childlike smile. But do not underestimate her, for pure innocence and pure ruthlessness are two sides of the same coin.

Gale of the Ice Tree.desc: Past the halfway point, warriors summoned by Maxwell and Abaddon block the path. There's no turning back now.

Garden of Idols.desc: Once a week, Nymphs, Spirits and Idols get together. Use this chance to get some super rare Evolution Material Units!

Garden of Imps.desc: You can only enter the Garden of Imps once a day. Little creatures are calling for a host to fuse with...

Garden of Nymphs.desc: Once a week, Nymphs, Spirits and Idols get together. Use this chance to get some Evolution Material Units!

Garden of Spirits.desc: Once a week, Nymphs, Spirits and Idols get together. Use this chance to get some rare Evolution Material Units!

Gate of Rejection.desc: There is a thick steel door at the entrance to the tower. Although it is open, you must defeat the monsters around you before going inside.

Gold Valley Lv. 1.desc: This dungeon of dreams is said to be inhabited by monsters made of Zel, the currency of this world..

Gold Valley Lv. 2.desc: This dungeon of dreams is said to be inhabited by monsters packed full of Zel, the currency of this world.

Gold Valley Lv. 3.desc: This dungeon of dreams is said to be inhabited by monsters bursting full of Zel, the currency of this world.

Grove of Suspicion.desc: How many years have passed since someone last walked this path? Surely this was a beautiful road back when it was taken care of.

Guardian of the Light.desc: You've nearly reached the middle of the temple. You can imagine the days when many would gather at this impressive alter.

Guardians of the Prairie.desc: You can see a rocky mountain faintly on the horizon. Tilith is waiting at the "Cave of Flames" just beyond here.

Guiding Light.desc: You have reached the opposite gate. Though there are no signs of Mare, you can sense a sinister heat approaching.

Hades Blast.desc: A gunshot suddenly echoes through the solemn sanctuary interior. As startled as you are, you see a shining marksman before you.

Hall of Annihilation.desc: Entering inside you notice the entire tower is slightly trembling. You must shake off this bad feeling and focus on the enemy in front of you.

Heavenly Intent.desc: The air is invigorating here. It'd be nice to stop here and take a deep breath. The view is so beautiful, maybe you can return here after Karl is rescued.

Hero of Agni Lv. 1.desc: Hero of the Agni Empire, Vargas' strength and blazing sword lit the flame in the people's hearts to believe that they had a chance against the gods.

Hero of Agni Lv. 2.desc: His immense powers were feared even by the gods. Even long after he left the empire, he was remembered by its people as the legendary swordsman of Agni.

Hero of Atharva Lv. 1.desc: Eze trained and fought hard as a  warrior and was rewarded with the Thunder Sword Batootha, which gave him the destructive power of thunder.

Hero of Atharva Lv. 2.desc: Eze tore down the gods with his Thunder Sword Batootha and his superior speed, rescuing Goddess Emilia and the masses during the great war.

Hero of Bariura Lv. 1.desc: As a cavalry leader's son, Magress was a talented young knight. Triggered by his defeat to his father, he honed his skills and soon became the strongest in Bariura.

Hero of Bariura Lv. 2.desc: Wielding a gigantic lance, he could effortlessly pierce through the thickest of armor. Even the gods couldn't stand in his way.

Hero of La Veda Lv. 1.desc: Gifted with extraordinary skills, Atro was known as the "Sword Saint" for his brilliant technique with the legendary Light Sword Urias.

Hero of La Veda Lv. 2.desc: When the gods destroyed the monastery he grew up in, he drew his sword and unleashed the unearthly powers of Urias, going all out against the gods.

Hero of Vriksha Lv. 1.desc: Picking up the Sacred Pike Drevas, Lance gave up his roots as a noble of the Principality of Vriksha to pursue greater skill and power.

Hero of Vriksha Lv. 2.desc: Lance stood up against the gods, but he was not alone. He had his awakened Demon Pike Drevas, which now held the powers of World Tree Altro.

Heroine of Sama Lv. 1.desc: Beautiful yet strong, Selena was admired by many for leading the Savat people of the Sama Kingdom to countless victorious battles.

Heroine of Sama Lv. 2.desc: Refusing the call from her kingdom, Selena instead wielded her treasured sword Lexida and cut down god after god to rescue the masses.

Hot Gale\u2019s Caress.desc: There’s no respite from the scalding heat. A gust of hot wind blasting through the maze of caverns.

Hotatsu Dance.desc: The city is enormous, befitting the once prosperous capital of an empire. Though it's smaller than Randall, make sure you don't get lost.

Howls and Gunshots.desc: As the fight continues to escalate, the sound of gunfire mixed in with the roar of monsters hints at even more danger to come. Could Lugina have found something?

Howls in the Void.desc: The dark mineshaft continues to beckon weary travelers deeper inside its murky maw. Monsters can smell fear, so whatever you do, beware your sweet scent.

Hunter from the Forest.desc: Dangerous hunters wielding longbows inhabit the depths of this forest, and they attack anyone who dares enter.

Hunter in the Green.desc: The verdant ocean of trees lives up to its name. Wherever you look, the sun's rays are blocked by lush greenery. Under your feet, the ground is covered in grass and moss.

Hunter of Death.desc: A glimmer of hope crosses your mind as you feel the route slowly ascending, though the air of death continues to loom about in the shadows around you.

Impending Radiance.desc: The rocky stretch under took some getting used to. But now that you have your feet planted, it's the perfect fighting ground.

In Comes a Fire God.desc: A figure watches you from the shadows as you attempt to leave the village. It seems all the intense fighting has attracted the attention of a fire god.

In Shining Shadows.desc: Thunder Hero Eze vol. 2 - Aware of his own weaknesses, he immerses himself in training. That is when he finds his partner for life.

In the Name of Thunder Lv. 3.desc: The sisters once chatted joyfully in the land of thunder. Now, not a trace of their happiness can be found.

In the Name of Thunder Lv. 4.desc: Do these bolts of lightning represent the rage of a sibyl of destruction, or are they her tears, shed over the battle with her sisters? The truth will never be known.

In the Sunlight.desc: After parting from Seria and Karl, you head toward the place where Cardes is sealed away, vanquishing enemies who appear from the silent forest.

Incarnation of Flames.desc: You've reached the desert's mid point. An incarnation of flames blocks the way, further scorching the land around it.

Incarnation of Thunder.desc: There's a temple barely visible in the distance. There's no sign of Karl, what has happened to him...

Incarnation of Water.desc: The end of the coastline is now in view. A Water Spirit is said to appear around here. How strong could it be?

Incarnation of the Dark.desc: Leaving the church, you continue through the ruins. The temple was so beautifully preserved, what could've happened here?

Incarnation of the Forest.desc: It's hard telling which trees are just trees and not just monsters in hiding. If only you could escape this forest...

Incarnation of the Light.desc: You can feel the enemies growing stronger the deeper you go. Unfortunately, the only way to the Tower of Morgan is forward.

Inferno Gate.desc: Welcome to the newly discovered realm of Cordelica. A huge gate towers above you, as if it were beckoning Summoners inside...

Into the Darkness.desc: A mine shaft winds its way in the direction of the Giant's Ruins. Monsters fond of the dank conditions lurk in the shadows, their fangs occasionally glinting in the darkness.

Invitation to Heaven.desc: A brightly shining gun-wielding warrior stands before you. You must fight against this force which threatens to rip away your very soul.

Jewel Parade!.desc: A big parade of Jewel monsters full of Zel is coming your way! The hunt for riches is on!

King of the World Below.desc: Thanks to the torch you can see ahead of you, but the ground is still dark. The flickering torch seems to make the darkness appear thicker.

Knight of the Holy City.desc: Continuing your search of the ruins, an overwhelming presence stops you in your tracks. Up ahead, a knight of the La Veda Republic lies in wait.

Knight of the Light.desc: Without provocation, hordes of shining demons swoop down on you. These demons must've been called upon by Maxwell...

Knight of the Ripples.desc: The beautiful view continues, as do the number of enemies you encounter. Prepare yourself for a water assault.

Labyrinth of Trees.desc: The overgrown foliage deep inside the forest is maze-like in its complexity. What lies on the other side?

Land of the Light.desc: There is a temple bathed in light. Despite it being thousands of years old, it's as beautiful as the day it was built.

Last Light of the Ruins.desc: You follow Lugina’s orders and launch yourself into the path of the marauding monsters. You have to give it all you've got on the front lines!

Light God's Progression.desc: There doesn't seem to be any particularly important information in the sanctuary. It's time to end your detour and set your sites back on Amdahl Castle.

Light Metal Parade.desc: A grand procession featuring Light Metal monsters with loads of Light experience is coming your way! Don't miss out!

Light Pulse.desc: The end of Amdahl, the first island in the Palmyna Archipelago, is within sight. However, there are still some rather troublesome enemies about...

Light and Darkness Intersect.desc: The unstable seal reveals a being of dark and light from within it. However, an unexpected opponent has set their sights on you!

Light from Above.desc: At this time of day, you must pay attention to your position in battle. When your enemies stand between you and the sun, their movements are hard to read.

Lightning Quick Attack.desc: The center of the mine is full of traps. Blades are also quickly flashing about. Eliminate those who stand in your way and advance!

Lightning Strikes.desc: Leave Lugina and Seria to their own devices for now. Around this bog are the lingering traces of civilization, as if it was once someone's home.

Lightning to the Heart.desc: The sun starts to dye the sky a blood orange hue. Though you can't see the tower Tilith spoke of, it mustn't be far. Keep going.

Lingering in the Ruins.desc: Something unusual stands before you amidst the rubble. Made of metal, it appears to be a summoned hero. Proceed slowly.

Living for Battle.desc: The cave connected to the tomb seems to extend even further below the sea. The damp air makes you shiver as it tickles the back of your neck.

Living with Might.desc: Those with great power are often overcome by it. However, legend speaks of one mighty warrior who succeeded in gaining control.

Long Blade Warrior.desc: You progress through the Alman Mausoleum, keeping your eye on the Sky Fort. Sensing a strong presence, you turn to find a warrior waving a large sword.

Lost Innocence.desc: In the following months after escaping the gods, they survived and adapted to dangers, slowly forging a special relationship going against all odds that lie before them.

Maiden of the Trees.desc: You feel your senses numbing as you're enveloped in a sea of red. It's probably not a good idea to stick around here.

Malevolent Ceremony.desc: You sense a strikingly ominous presence coming from the path ahead. What awaits you isn't a god like before, but some being with a strong resentment toward humans.

Manipulator of the Dark.desc: Light energy is strong against dark, but it's also its weakness. You must plan your strategy here carefully.

Manipulator of the Water.desc: You are making progress, but the end of the snowscape still isn't visible. Don't forget to plan for water enemies.

Master of Lomass.desc: A massive tree stretches into the heavens from the center of the forest. There's no chance of passing through the forest's twisting maze without its blessing.

Metal Parade!.desc: Take part in this grand parade and capture some of these metal type monsters, bursting full of fusion experience!!

Mischief and Malice.desc: Karl and Seria, will those two be able to fight their way out of this predicament? There's no time to worry as a monster with a taste for mischief appears before you.

Monsters of the Corridor.desc: This tower reaches amazingly high into the sky. Fearsome monsters await with blood-soaked claws.

Monsters of the Prairie.desc: The calm grasslands keep on going.The monsters here are just right for a beginner.Keep moving forward.

Moonlight Dance Lv. 3.desc: Mesmerized and enthralled by the bright yet silent moon, curious creatures begin dancing to the mystical feeling in the air.

Moonlit Battle.desc: A warrior of light lies in wait in the depths of these ruins, testing adventurers before they're allowed to pass.

Moonlit Path Lv. 1.desc: As night falls, the shine of the moon lights up the darkness, enticing curious creatures to come out to play.

Mountain Snowstorm.desc: You've emerged from the base of a mountain. Now it's intensely cold, and it seems to be taking its toll on Tilith.

Mysterious Paradise.desc: Entry to the Mysterious Paradise is only granted once a day. Croaking voices can be heard echoing in the distance.

Nature's Wild Child Lv. 1.desc: She doesn't have the slightest clue about her past, but she knows one thing well and clear. She needs to get stronger.

Nature's Wild Child Lv. 2.desc: The mountains are more dangerous than they look, but nothing will stop her from sharpening her senses as well as her claws.

Nature's Wild Child Lv. 3.desc: "Never underestimate a cat," she always warns, and those who cross her only realize it when they feel her claws dig in.

Never Ending Rain.desc: According to Karl and Seria, Graham has already left this place. However, you should still be cautious as you proceed.

No Turning Back.desc: Your enemies' aggression continues to grow, but as long as your comrades are behind you there's no choice but to fight your way forth.

Noble Roar.desc: You cannot rely on Lugina against Mare's tricks. Though you want to preserve your energy for your solo fight, the enemies' attacks just get fiercer.

Noble War Hero.desc: In this harshly windblown wasteland exists a lone warrior whose solitary lifestyle aptly befits their surroundings.

Of Thunder and Flames.desc: When lightning strikes it sometimes ignites the earth where it hits. The force that controls the lightning and flames has set their aim on you.

One Day in the Woods.desc: It's hot and humid in this dark forest. It's not as hot here as it was in that steamy cavern, but you're already beginning to sweat.

One Eyed Giant.desc: You look below to see a horrifyingly deep ravine. A thunderous roar can be heard from deep beneath. A single massive eye peeks at you.

Out the Window Lv. 2.desc:
The strange musician and the girl who listened to him.
It seems their songs are helping the tree to grow.

Out the Window Lv. 3.desc:
The tree grows as if it was being fed by the instruments.
Could its branches reach to where the girl came from?

Overwhelming Green.desc: Mare the demon is a master of deception. Her last words may be a ruse. However, her next attack could be imminent.

Party On Board.desc: Monsters snarl in unison as they scheme to make you their main dish at this ghost ship party.

Penetrate the Impenetrable Darkness.desc: At time there are cracks in the darkness that appear to bones. Your ears pick up on what sounds like the woeful cries of long dead soldiers.

Period of Mortality.desc: What floor is this? Suddenly looking outside, the once massive bridge now looks relatively small. The top is near, prepare yourself and move forth.

Phantom Pots.desc: It is said that those with good taste hold lavish parties to display their favorite pots. It is rumored that these pots are also very rare evolution materials...

Phoenix and the Sea Monster.desc: Nothing poses a greater threat to Summoners than monsters of opposite elements cooperating to launch a combination attack. Fire and water, for instance...

Phoenix of the Volcano.desc: Just as you were about to escape the volcano, it seems an undead beast is blocking your path...

Pillars of Green.desc: You must properly thank Lugina later for securing Karl's safety. Being Mare's prisoner must not have been a cakewalk.

Pirate of the Shallow Waters.desc: A huge ship is anchored on the beach. It's a pirate ship, and it seems there's no easy way past...

Pirate of the Wetlands.desc: Seems there are bandits around here, too. They used to call the skies their own, but what strength that must've taken...

Pitch Dark Forests.desc: Your eyes haven't adjusted to the dark since coming in from the coast. Are Karl and the others OK?

Plan for Eternity.desc: The trees here seem able to withstand exposure to lightning. However, in noticing this it seems you have become lost.

Prayer at Dawn.desc: Sunlight pours into the tower, as if cheering you on. But you must have no time for such thoughts and must head upward toward your enemy.

Presence of Flames.desc: You can feel the flames growing stronger. This might be a sign that something dangerous is waiting ahead.

Pretty Little Flowers.desc: All of a sudden, sunshine bathes you as the old growth gives way to young foliage. The fresh flowers are a pleasure to your senses.

Princess of the Icy Blade.desc: You've finally reached the coast's end. A dark forest is visible ahead, but surely something is lurking near...

Princess of the Pond.desc: Nearing a pond at the edge of the prairie, some Water Nymphs stand in your way as if they're protecting something. What could it be?

Princess of the Snowscape.desc: You sense a sudden drop in temperature around you. Judging from experience, this means danger is not far off.

Proof of a Hero.desc: Paris said there should be a shrine dedicated to the God of Light around here. A great force stands before you as if to protect the souls of those betrayed by the gods.

Protected by the Sky Lv. 3.desc: This sparkling shrine was once the pride of the Six Sisters. Now, without a master, rampant monsters lurk in alongside the souls of the sibyls of destruction.

Protected by the Sky Lv. 4.desc: The sibyl who had the kindness and mercy to forgive all sins, yet she couldn't save those closest to her. What might she reveal to a Summoner able to capture her?

Protection at All Costs.desc: The sea breeze feels comfortable against your skin, as does the sunlight coming from your left. But do not let your guard down.

Protector of Nature.desc: Spots of nature continue to exist even in this most man-made of environments. Unfortunately, nature isn’t always man’s ally...

Protector, Destructor.desc: Judging by the dismal state of the town, the people kept fighting even after the surrounding walls were destroyed. Their determination is to be respected.

Pulverizing Combo.desc: The enemies' vicious attacks are taking their toll. However, this is hardly the place to catch your breath, for Karl's life is in your hands.

Puppeteer of the Trees.desc: This monster-packed forest just goes on forever. Everything's the same, seems like you're walking in circles...

Pure Magic Barrier.desc: You pick up an item while advancing through the destroyed city. It's a powerful magic barrier, the likes of which have never been seen.

Race Through the City.desc: Tilith injured herself investigating how to get to the Spirit World. You must repay her by making your way to Cardes!

Radiant Helix.desc: The sunlight shining on the sanctuary is as pleasant as Tilith said it would be, but who is this coming in to bathe in the light the same as she would have...

Raging Heat Wave.desc: You've arrived at the increadibly hot Dejour Ruins. Monsters trapped in the red hot winds block your way forth.

Raining Flashes.desc: Deep black storm clouds fill the sky. Lightning falls in endless waves upon the forest below. There's no way anything could live here.

Rallying Spirits.desc: The enemy's attacks have gotten stronger. Perhaps you're nearing the top. With this much resistance, it must mean that Karl is ahead!

Rampage of the Giants.desc: The source of the strange sensation is revealed in a legendary giants with powers rivaling those of the gods. Do you run, or stay and fight?

Released by Shadows.desc: The stench of death that fills the cave twists your imagination in an ominous way. However, you pray that Lugina is able to rescue Karl.

Reminisence.desc: Xenon & Estia revisit their past of wandering the wilderness together, after escaping from their burning kingdom in search of allies to regroup..

Revival of the World Tree.desc: Earth Hero Lance vol. 2 - Led by his demon pike, Lance headed for the World Tree. However, something was waiting for him there.

Rondo of Nightmares.desc: A faint light glimmers at the end of what seemed like never-ending darkness. Standing before it, a nightmarish monster rears its head, revealing a bewitching smile.

Rooted to the Earth.desc: Suddenly, the miasma from the bog disappears. The air which was once difficult to breath is now fresh and clean. This is likely cause for concern.

Roots in Nirvana.desc: You've made it a long way down the muddy path. The end of the marsh is near, but a remarkably large tree stands in front of you. Surely it isn't an ordinary tree.

Ruins of Dark.desc: The Temple of Dark, said to be the birthplace of an incredible power. Novices would be wise not to enter.

Ruins of Earth Lv. 3.desc: The Temple of Earth, said to be the birthplace of an incredible power. Novices would be wise not to enter.

Ruins of Fire Lv. 3.desc: The Temple of Fire, said to be the birthplace of an incredible power. Novices would be wise not to enter.

Ruins of Light.desc: The Temple of Light, said to be the birthplace of an incredible power. Novices would be wise not to enter.

Ruins of Miracles Lv. 4.desc: This temple is devoted to a god who's said to have the power to draw out one's ultimate power. The power to defeat gods awaits you deep within.

Ruins of Thunder Lv. 3.desc: The Temple of Thunder, said to be the birthplace of an incredible power. Novices would be wise not to enter.

Ruins of Water Lv. 3.desc: The Temple of Water, said to be the birthplace of an incredible power. Novices would be wise not to enter.

Ruler of the Water.desc: Around the summit, stones are stacked in a alter-like pattern. Is this proof that the mountain was a place of worship?

Rushing the Enemy.desc: Scores of monsters block your path forward, but there’s no turning back now. Show them who’s boss by attacking them head-on.

Sacred Land of the Souls Lv. 1.desc: The sacred grounds from which all living beings originate. Soak up some of the overflowing Karma.

Sacred Land of the Souls Lv. 2.desc: Further within the sacred grounds from which all living beings originate. Soak up even more of the overflowing Karma.

Sacred Land of the Souls Lv. 3.desc: A hidden domain in the sanctuary that watches over all living things. Now's your chance to get more Karma than you could ever imagine!

Sacred Ruins.desc: These ancient ruins have a solemn, holy air. It's much better than where you were before, but it's still ominous.

Saint and Devil.desc: You've entered the castle's banquet hall. The sacred walls reek of wickedness, but you mustn't hesitate. Advance, for Tilith!

Scars from the Great War.desc: This place once hosted a battle between humans and the gods. Even after many years, it still bears the scars of those days.

Scorching Roars.desc: A world of inferno awaits you as you proceed further into the dark cave. The molten lava glows brightly, but behind it lies a sinister darkness.

Scorching Trails.desc: You're now in Maxwell's stronghold, St. Lamia. Many tall mountains are visible in the distance. The land looks rugged.

Sea of Wicked Thoughts.desc: You feel the ominous presence of countless lost souls wandering about the area. What could this evil force be amidst the sorrowful howls?

Secret of the Blade.desc: The ruins are quite old, but magic still illuminates the area. What's strange, however, is that it isn't fire, but the power of thunder magic which is being used.

Serenade in the Waves.desc: The beach is peppered with Lugina's footprints. He warned you not to follow him, but you have no choice. You proceed along the shoreline.

Shadowless Creatures.desc: The Stairway to the Heavens has narrowed. You can no longer hear the shouts from the base. You're almost there.

Shadowy Forests.desc: Beyond the snow lie the forests that the sun doesn't reach. Beware, there are signs of monsters are all around.

Shining Stage Lv. 1.desc: A curious stage has been found deep within ancient ruins. And with it, a young songstress singing atop it. What could her message to the Summoners be?

Shining Stage Lv. 2.desc: A diva found on the odd stage in the ruins. Her angelic voice continues to charm all Summoners. However, a certain one among them would change her...

Shining Stage Lv. 3.desc: A diva found on the odd stage in the ruins. With a voice that once charmed the gods themselves, its sound makes humans forget the passage of time.

Showdown under the Flowers.desc: Further into the ocean of trees you see some covered in exquisite flowers. Their petals rain down as the armored princess and gunner from another world approach.

Snowbound Waypoints.desc: You take a peek in all directions and are met with stark whiteness. Try not to lose your sense of direction. Follow the sparse trees and the sun's movements.

Soaring through the Sky.desc: Perhaps Mare is afraid of the power some humans wield. That would explain her incessant attempts to wear you down.

Solemn Grounds.desc: The atmosphere is ominously heavy in this solemn seminary. Maintain focus and keep moving forward.

Sound of Destruction.desc: Dark clouds drape the sky above, punctuated by incessant lightning that racks your nerves. You must sneak past carefully, ready for Mare's next attack.

Stairway to Extinction.desc: It's a long way to the top, and on top of that there are even more enemies here than outside. What Paris said now stirs uneasiness within you.

Stairway to the Heavens.desc: This tower is like a gigantic fortress. The spiral stairs that surround its vast outer walls are the only way up...

Standing in the Snow.desc: Before you notice, your once wet hair and clothes are frozen. Surely you'll catch a cold in this radically changing weather. Brush away the frost and hurry ahead.

Start of Adventure.desc: Your journey as a Summoner traveling across Grand Gaia has begun! Go forth, and don't forget what Tilith taught you!

Stormy Surprise Attack.desc: The sky has become brighter. It seems you might soon be able to escape this strange weather. Is Lugina waiting ahead like he said he'd be?

Super Metal Parade!.desc: A grand procession featuring only Metal Units that are Super Rare and above! Metal Kings and above guaranteed, don't miss this great chance!

Supreme God of Fire.desc: Fire Hero Vargas vol. 3 - The violent battle with the gods. Fighting alongside his comrades as well as rivals, this is where the fire hero's legend began.

Swift Blowing Flames.desc: Pushing aside the steamy air, a scorching hot wind blows in. The parched air instantly dries your once sweat covered body.

Sword of Fire.desc: A hero wielding a sword of fire waits ahead. You must somehow sneak past the mix of holy and unholy flames and make it out of the cave.

Sword of Lightning Speed.desc: You reached the temple's innermost area. A mighty swordsman awaits you, and you can surely expect a fierce battle...

Sword of Protection.desc: You notice elaborate carvings in the pieces of stone around your feet. The powderized remains of buildings speak of the violent battle that took place here.

Terminal Thunderstorm.desc: You reach the opposite end of the marsh. It doesn't seem like Grahdens is being held anywhere around here. Proceed to the sea.

That Which Haunts the Ruins.desc: As rough as the inside of the ruins is, they still seem to be intact. There also don't appear to be any traps to protect from intruders, but still...

The Amorphus Being.desc: There's a cavern just behind the Ignia Falls. A mysterious beast has awaken deep inside, seemingly disturbed by your battle with the giants. What could it be?

The Ancient Forest's Guardian.desc: Various strange flowers bloom proudly around you. Their mixing smells produce a strange aroma. It's almost...intoxicating...

The Ash Covered Hill.desc: Encervis, the second island in the Palmyna Archipelago. You first come across its scorching hot volcanic ash covered hills.

The Ash-Covered Pass.desc: Entering the mountains the sky grows dark. Could it be because of the smoke rising up from the volcanic ash? Dead trees line the path ahead.

The Bandits\u2019 Feast.desc: You’ve stumbled into a thriving monster habitat. Judging by the hungry glint in their eyes, you’re probably the first human they’ve seen in centuries.

The Bandits\u2019 Trap.desc: Even after the world has been reduced to rubble, the souls of bandits continue to exist deep within the forest. They target travelers’ valuables, just like when they were alive.

The Banished Fire Dragon.desc: You finally made it through the pass. The intense heat hasn't gone, but at least it's all downhill from here. Hurry on ahead.

The Battleaxe Descends.desc: Just as you’re about to exit on the other side of Ignia Falls, a watery monarch emerges from behind the waterfall. He’s come to expel the intruders in his domain...

The Bewitching Tactician.desc: You're nearing the center of the wastelands. Did Karl and his team successfully bring down the demon they were chasing?

The Black Candelabrum.desc: You have reached the innermost area of the shrine. You will have to defeat the remaining enemies here before you flush Mare out, but do not worry: you are not alone.

The Black Flame Warrior.desc: As you cross over the ash stained hills, a figure blanketed in black flames appears before you. A smile comes across your face, delighted to have come across such a warrior.

The Blazing Beast.desc: Looks like you'll be able to leave this cave soon, but there seems to be something sinister awaiting you at the end.

The Blizzard Begins.desc: A wielder of ice magic carrying a terrifying axe stands in your way. A fierce battle is about to start, but make it quick. The snowfield's exit is near.

The Blue Hallway.desc: Rescuing Karl surely threw a wrench into Mare's plans. If you can attack her head-on and avoid her trickery, you have quite a fighting chance.

The Box of Desires Lv. 1.desc: A dangerous cave full of traps to ensnare those who dare enter. Despite its dangers, many still venture after its treasures.

The Box of Desires Lv. 2.desc: Further into the dangerous, trap-filled cave. Mountains of treasure or oceans of despair, who knows what awaits!

The Box of Desires Lv. 3.desc: There are many secrets in this trap-filled cave. Do you fear getting trapped in despair, or are you hopeful to find riches!?

The Bridge to Ruin.desc: Now that you stand near the bridge it looks a lot bigger than it seamed from far away. You can see an ominous tower far in the distance, but could that be the end?

The Bullet in the Ice.desc: It is dry here as well, but for a different reason than it was up in the mountains. It's impossible to stand still in this cold. Could Lugina really be waiting here?

The Burning Desert.desc: Your journey through Morgan begins in a huge desert. The scorching haze indicates the fierce battle to come.

The Burning Hero.desc: Everybody knows of the hero from Agni clad in flames. His reputation precedes him, like the sinister air that fills the passageway in front of you.

The Captivated Water Sprite.desc: Unlike the Volcano Eldent, this blizzard-covered sacred mountain has many steep cliffs. Watch your step.

The Castle Gates Open.desc: Now knowing how dangerous the Sky Fort really is, you must put all you have into taking it down per Elder Grah's request.

The Coiling Shadows.desc: Why was Karl kidnapped? Mare said she wished to show him the truth, but still...Karl is your closest friend. You must save him.

The Commander of Fire.desc: This land is said to inspire the spirit of warfare in its inhabitants. Judging from the enemies standing in your way, this seems to be true.

The Commander of Flames.desc: Thirst and hunger line the scorching path ahead. In the steamy distance awaits a chef unmoved by the heat. What ingredients could she be looking for?

The Commander's Pets.desc: You're reached the deepest reaches of the Sky Fort. Zebra is close at hand, but your way is blocked by what were some of the greatest warriors to have ever lived.

The Commander's Power.desc: Amdahl Castle, where vengeful ghosts of the past are said to reside. Through here is the only way to get to Palmyna, the land sealed away by Cardes the Malevolent.

The Commander's Skill.desc: According to Elder Grah, a vengeful ghost that resents humans lives here. Still, you mustn't lose your way, even if only to prevent yourself from becoming a ghost as well.

The Corpse Producing Machine.desc: You can hear a ghastly noise coming from the roof. It's the final gate protecting Lizeria's hidden power. Muster your courage and go forth.

The Crumbling City.desc: Grandelt was once the most vibrant city in Palmyna, but it has since turned into a ghost town. Lined with abandoned buildings, it now stands in ruins.

The Crumbling God.desc: The air is dry as always, but it's getting harder and harder to breath. After a short break, an intense roar echoes from afar.

The Cursed Snake.desc: A monster with snakes for arms has appeared. Beware, it seems many adventurers have been subdued by its strength.

The Death-beckoning Devil.desc: You seem to have finally figured your way out of the cave, but all of the sudden an unsettling evil presence descends upon you...

The Demon Pike's Seed.desc: Earth Hero Lance vol. 1 - Lance and his demon pike. Continuing his fateful journey, many a powerful foe appeared before him.

The Divine Emperor.desc: You have made it to the top of the tower after defeating the burning hero. But now you must do what the gods couldn't and defeat the Fallen God Zevalhua!

The Divine Wind Blows.desc: As a stiff wind blows down on you from the ravine making it difficult to even stand, in an instant the sky grows dark. You look up to see something hovering above you...

The Domain of Despair.desc:
A mysterious area that suddenly appeared in the Vortex.
On orders from the Akras Summoners’ Hall, hunters are being sent to investigate the area and rid it of monsters.

The Dragon Hunting Ice Knight.desc: The end of this cold snow field has come into view at last. However, it seems one of Maxwell's knights is waiting just ahead.

The Earth Shattering Spear.desc: The darkness has lightened. The exit should be close, but there's tension in the air. Surely, the sign of a formidable foe.

The Endless Blackout.desc: The festering miasma in this town is not simply the remnants of warfare. You are certain that forbidden curses were used in these parts.

The Endless Shores.desc: You've reached the shore, escaping the desert. A calm, beautiful beach awaits you, but you must still be cautious.

The Endless Struggle.desc: You come across an unending battle, where man and brute fight over who gets to lay claim to the other's soul.

The Endlessly Dying Witch.desc: Monsters rush at you as if under some sort of spell. This appears to be a challenge from one who possesses power that transcends even death.

The Eroding Barricade.desc: You've reached the top at last. Continue on and defeat Abaddon and Graham, you can't let Karl and the others down!

The Flames that Rule.desc: As you head toward Cardes, your way is blocked by nymphs and dragons that command the power of fire. Their presence is like that of an overwhelming pillar of flames.

The Flourishing Garden.desc: This area is obviously sacred, bathed in light and covered in green, but being so close to St. Lamia Palace surely strong foes await.

The Foot of the Rainbow.desc: You exit the infernal cave and come upon a huge waterfall spanned by a breathtaking rainbow. Finally, some beautiful scenery to soothe your weary soul.

The Foreboding Gunshot.desc: Could this path also be part of the ruins? The moss covered path and crumbling statues show show the passage of time. Still, this is no time to relax.

The Forest's Savior.desc: It's been countless years since the last of the humans died out, but still the forest doesn't sleep. It seems it has thrived in their absence.

The Forest's Sublimation.desc: Earth Hero Lance vol. 3 - The gods' invasion had at last begun. Inspired by the demon pike, this is where the earth hero's legend began.

The Forest's Uneasy Peace.desc: Plants that you've never seen before flourish everywhere. Smash your way through this overflowingly vibrant forest just as Seria would expect you to.

The Forged Gigantor.desc: You're almost at the top. A mechanical deity, likely Maxwell's creation, awaits. The final battle for Mistral begins.

The Fourfold Pillar.desc: You can feel the fallen god's presence grow stronger as you proceed. However, surely he has set up a powerful defensive line before him.

The Frozen Surface.desc: A chilling wind blows across the lake. Attempting to shrug off the piercing cold, the temperature around you drops unnaturally. What could it be?

The Gallant Earth God.desc: On your way from the prairie, someone has been sent to block your path. Carefully proceed forward.

The Gates of Hell.desc: This castle once was revered for its majesty. While still impressive, it's surrounded in a sinister atmosphere.

The Giant God Awakes.desc: After defeating the giants, you now face the toughest challenge of all in their king, Grantos. The final showdown to determine the fate of Cordelica is about to begin.

The Giant's Dream.desc: The end of the road is in sight. However, as you advance the monsters only grow in numbers. You must maintain focus as you move ahead.

The Goddess of War.desc: Seems even a holy goddess has been called on to block your path. However, you must defeat her and press on if you're to save Tilith.

The Golden Hall.desc: The shrine at the bottom of the ocean has a confusing, unearthly aura. The fact that Lugina was able to find Karl here is impressive.

The Golden Halo.desc: As you climb up the stairs, you see a tremendous enemy blocking the sunlight. Make the heroes before you proud and trounce this ten-winged tormentor!

The Graceful Figure.desc: On your way toward Amdahl Castle, an incredibly graceful figure appears before you. Vanquish it and move ahead.

The Great Wall.desc: A man-eating demon and an ancient dragon wrapped in flames block the path toward Obselion Castle where Tilith awaits you.

The Heinous Chamber.desc: This spine-chillingly eerie mansion reeks of an evil presence. Here you'll need the power to oppose darkness.

The Holy Sky Mech Lv. 1.desc: While others struggle on the ground, she soars through the sky to wherever the light reaches, and fights for those who seek freedom.

The Holy Sky Mech Lv. 2.desc: If death can't stop her, nothing will. As long as there is a ray of light, she'll trace it down, even to Gaia's end.

The Holy Sky Mech Lv. 3.desc: Stronger, higher, faster. Whoever said the sky's the limit obviously never met Vanila. To this airborne warrior, the sky is but the starting line.

The Hunter of Time.desc: The discomfort you felt in the forests of Mistral is back, but this time it's worse. Could this be the work of a time mage?

The Ice Cold Warrior.desc: You proceed alongside the lake, headed toward the Sky Fort. Alongside the light of the sun being reflected off the lake is the reflection of a single icy blade.

The Ice Covered Castle.desc: The royal family of Palmyna once resided in this magnificent castle. It's beautifully frozen corridors now give off a feeling of sadness.

The Ice that Binds.desc: As you approach the end of the beach, the sand turns to mud. If experience has taught you anything, something formidable should be waiting ahead.

The Indestructible Formation.desc: There's a sturdy tower intricately built from white stones. From its appearance, it looks like it was built as a military fortress, but it feels creepy.

The Iron-Fisted Lady Lv. 1.desc: A boxer who set out on an epic journey to discover her origins. Her fists make mincemeat out of any who dare to approach her.

The Iron-Fisted Lady Lv. 2.desc: She has sworn to continue traveling until she finds the answers she’s looking for. A world of hurt awaits any who stand in her way.

The Iron-Fisted Lady Lv. 3.desc: None exist who haven’t heard of this true brawling legend. She respects only those who understand the true meaning of destruction.

The Iron-Fisted Lady Lv. 4.desc: A martial artist at her very peak, a master of brute destruction. Pride is her only weakness.

The Keymaster's Eclipse Lv. 1.desc: A strange eclipse, an unfamiliar silhouette. He who holds the key has tapped into a long lost power, a hypnotic force that is spread across Grand Gaia.

The Keymaster's Eclipse Lv. 2.desc: Dark and light, good and evil...can you maintain balance, or will you give in to the Keymaster's magic? The force of the eclipse is growing...

The Knight in Crimson.desc: You are still surprised that Lugina is cooperating in Karl's rescue. Though his words suggest otherwise, he isn't such a bad person.

The Lake's Allure.desc: While gazing upon the beautiful lake, you hear a lovely singing voice. However you mustn't be seduced by it, because the being it's coming from surely isn't human.

The Lakeside Master.desc: As you're searching the lakeside, you suddenly see a great shadow on the surface of the water. It's likely the ruler of Lake Aldela.

The Land Devoured by Monsters.desc: You see ruins as you escape from the temple. It seems that whatever existed here before was destroyed by a great power.

The Light that Vanquishes Evil.desc: Continuing this solo battle is both physically and emotionally taxing. Try not to worry about Karl, or you'll play right into Mare's hands.

The Limits of Wisdom and Courage.desc: Though walking along the shore reminds you of your time with Tilith back at Morgan, there is no time for reminiscing. Brace yourself and press ahead.

The Lone Bounty Hunter.desc: Thunder Hero Eze vol. 1 - Eze, in his younger days as a demon bounty hunter. Experience the fateful meeting that changed his life forever.

The Lone Traveller Lv. 1.desc: A traveler on the first steps of her journey. Her inexperience clouds her ability to see the value in friendship.

The Lone Traveller Lv. 2.desc: A traveler who has come to be known throughout the land. She's realized the value of having someone to train with.

The Lone Traveller Lv. 3.desc: A valiant traveler who commands praise wherever she goes. She continues her journey, always on the look out for worthy allies.

The Lone Traveller Lv. 4.desc: A celebrated traveler who is almost unmatched in her swordsmanship. Her skills had brought her to be able to match herself to fight against the gods' invasion.

The Long Shot.desc: Mare's abduction of Karl was an act of suicide. But why would Zevalhua take Grahdens captive?

The Lusting Snake.desc: As you proceed, you realize the ruins cover a large area. It must have been a large city before.

The Mad God Descends.desc: Powerful enough to surpass even a goddess, the demonic Zebra is waiting just ahead. Strengthen your will as preparedness may become a vital weapon in the end.

The Magnificent Pegasus.desc: You continue even deeper into the massive temple. You can make out the solemn silhouettes of pegasi standing about.

The Majestic Trees.desc: You happen upon an old tree that manages to stand out in the ocean of its peers. Though not much taller than the others, it is far wider. You must make your way around it.

The Meaning of Holiness.desc: There is a solemn atmosphere in the mausoleum where the natives pray to their god of light. However, there isn't enough time to investigate this supposed god any further...

The Meaning of Irate Souls.desc: Continuing deeper into the ruins in search of the strange sensation’s source, you come across souls driven mad mad by anger. What could have done this?

The Midnight Aristocrat.desc: It seems you've reached the dark, damp reaches of this hellish cave. Follow the wind to find your way out.

The Mischievous Goddess.desc: Lorand, one of the Heroes of Old. The place where he once taught as a professor has now been overtaken by dangerous monsters.

The Monster Slaying Blade.desc: A grotesque swordsman awaits you, and you must overcome him in order to reach the Tower of Mistral.

The Moonlit Fortress.desc: Do as Lugina says and defeat the hordes of monsters dwelling within the fortress. You’ll be able to continue with your investigation afterwards.

The Mountain-dwelling Devil.desc: The summit is in sight, and you've spotted the altar. The end is near, but there are signs of a beast nearby...

The Never-Ending Tower.desc: Don't let Karl and Seria's wishes go to waste. Ascend the tower quickly and track down Abaddon and Graham!

The Ocean Master.desc: The path toward the old castle is open before you on the other side of the lake. However before you waits a sea god, wearing a fearless smile.

The Open Seal.desc: The path to Cardes is now open. Now's your chance to put an end to him, and once again show your power over the gods!

The Path Begins.desc: A new investigation has begun into the land of Lizeria. The path to the once thriving La Veda Republic lies open, covered in weeds as it may be.

The Path Forward.desc: You couldn't find Tilith, but just as Grahdens said, you must put your faith in her and move forth. Your goal is to defeat Cardes.

The Peculiar Black Knight.desc: You reached the ruins' end. The majestic Tower of Morgan stands before you. However, a knight in thick armor awaits...

The Pegasus Maiden.desc: A wind gently blows through the soft sunlight. Exiting the ruins, you seem to be on the side of a mountain. The sky is clear and the weather is pleasant.

The Phony Paradise.desc: As expected, Maxwell has filled his base with incredibly powerful beings. Liberating them is going to be difficult.

The Pillars of Force.desc: Masters of each of the four elements stand in wait as the final barrier in the path to the lord of the tower.

The Pirate on Ice.desc: You've reached the center of the icy field. Beware, apparently there are pirates about on the ice...

The Power Seeking Swordsman.desc: The end of the desert is in view, and the wind now smells of the sea. However, a giant silhouette stands blocks your path...

The Power that Protects.desc: You worry about Karl's safety in the hands of Mare. However, now is the time to hurry ahead, not to think ominous thoughts about your friend.

The Precarious Beast Master.desc: A summoned being known as the king of beasts is rampaging in the desert. A fierce battle with him is unavoidable.

The Princess' Ball.desc: The beautifully decorated interior of the castle suggests that at one time many an extravagant banquet was held here. But all relics aside, it's time to head further inside.

The Raged Beast of Destruction.desc: You can make out St. Lamia Palace in the distance, but the roar of a beast from the foothills nearby are concerning...

The Rainbow Battlefield.desc: You have never felt air this thick with tension and signs of enemies nearby. Prepare yourself, for the next battle may be your last.

The Rainbow Crowned Queen.desc: The sprawling snowscape before you is gorgeous, but as much as you'd like to stare this isn't the time to get distracted. You must catch up to Karl.

The Red Gate.desc: Your exhaustion from the journey to rescue Karl has worn off. Perhaps the strong human bond between you that Mare loves to mock has its benefits.

The Reign Over Agni.desc: As he finally claims the territory of the ruined Agni Empire, Leon faces officials, angry gods, and summoners charging up his doorstep. Believing in equality among men, a thief of justice, facing all odds with his cunning and wits.

The Riotous Thunderbird.desc: The Thunderbird circles above, letting out a piercing cry. You've no choice but to confront it and take it down.

The Roar in the Forest.desc: From far away you thought you saw a large tree, but now it seems to be coming toward you. Is this an illusion, or is the tree really moving?

The Roar of Triumph.desc: The top level of the white tower. The dragon slowly turns its gaze to you, and lets out a deafening roar. You have to defeat it and save Karl!

The Roaring Warrior.desc: The bandits tell of a dragon who protects all the trees in the forest. Could that be where this distant roar is coming from?

The Rotting Bridge.desc: After parting with Karl and Seria you proceed through the mines. Making your way through the monster infested tunnels, you come across a decaying bridge.

The Royal Bodyguard.desc: Fighting your enemies here makes you feel like a tomb raider. There don't seem to be too many booby-traps set in the tomb, but be careful.

The Sal Trees.desc: As sunlight begins to peek into the forest, it seems you might be able to get out. Karl and Seria are in the ruins ahead. You must hurry to them.

The Scars of War.desc: Amdahl, one of the islands in the Palmyna Archipelago which is ruled over by Cardes the Malevolent. A town can be seen near the entrance, having been devastated by war.

The Scorched Pathway.desc: Your sights now rest on Cardes, one of the Four Fallen Gods. However the path ahead is scorching hot due to the blistering hot sun above.

The Seal Breaks.desc: Just as Tilith said, the seal is nearly broken. As you wonder how you should deal with it, hordes of crazed monsters are looking to prey on you.

The Shadow in the Trees.desc: All manner of beasts try and stand in your way as you work towards the Spirit World, the land where Cardes is sealed away...

The Shining Ice Flow.desc: The comfortable sea breeze is a perfect complement to the sun's strong rays. But you don't have time to enjoy it and must keep searching for where Karl is being held.

The Shining Tower.desc: You arrive at the Tower of Light hot on the heels of Lugina and Paris. Could the mystery of Cordelica really lie within its radiant and lofty walls?

The Skies Above.desc: You look up to see the Sky Fort! Have faith in Tilith and push your way through this final obstacle!

The Sky Devouring Bird.desc: You're now headed for the Noera Battlegrounds. However, the sky suddenly turns black as you look up to see a massive figure above.

The Skyhigh Tower.desc: You've reached the Tower of Mistral at last. This is Maxwell's base inside Mistral. Hurry your way inside!

The Spear of Justice.desc: You sense a strong enemy near the exit to the ruins. Zevalhua's disciple Mare was able to read Seria's movements in attacking her. Be careful.

The Spirit World Descends.desc: You've all made your way to the Spirit World. Now you must put your heads together to defeat Cardes, and then get back together safely.

The Spoiled Fresco.desc: The carvings here are even more ornate than those near the entrance of the ruins. A fresh gash runs horizontally across one of the giant frescoes. What could've done this?

The Spring of Power.desc: This place is also inhabitable. It's doubtful anyone could even last a minute around here. Hurry on ahead.

The Stairs of Trial.desc: Halfway up, a giant flying dragon is defends the tower, attacking anyone who nears. You must avoid it's attacks to advance.

The Steamy Path.desc: It's like a steam bath here, the hot steam making it hard to breathe. It'd be difficult to wear armor travelling through a place like this.

The Swift Marksman.desc: As you traverse the whitewashed landscape, you're surprised by a firm, icy sound. It's the echo of icy gunfire headed your way!

The Tarnished Peaks.desc: You're halfway through St. Lamia, and Tilith's deteriorating condition has worsened. It's time to hurry.

The Thief's Hideout.desc: You've come far, but there's still no exit in site. There are supposed to be bandits in this area.

The Thunder Troupe.desc: You must escape the ruins to get to the tower where Karl is being held. Tilith can take care of Seria, so hurry ahead as fast as you can.

The Thunder Wrecked Land.desc: After escaping the pitch black forest, you entered a vast wasteland. The area is being torn apart by lightning.

The Thundering Strategist.desc: At the end of these unpleasant wetlands the way is blocked by a former hero of Grand Gaia who was summoned by Maxwell.

The Trembling Earth.desc: Escaping between the rows of crumbling buildings, you're jolted by a sudden tremor. Could this be Gaia's rage? Or maybe...

The Unrivalled Fool.desc: Thunder Hero Eze vol. 3 - In the violent battle with the gods, he almost loses what matters to him most. Watch, as he unlocks his true power!

The Voice of God.desc: An overwhelming presence emanates from the top of the tower. Could it be the legendary power bestowed upon those who’ve heard the voice of the gods?

The Wandering Spirit Lv. 1.desc: Heroes and spirits from all over gather among these dangerous ruins. Now's your chance to gather hordes of Material Units!
